input.body:
Dear {{trigger['body']['data'][0]['value']}}, 

Thank you for applying for the consultancy role at eHealth4everyone. We have received your application and appreciate your interest in joining our team. 
Our HR team will carefully review your application over the next two weeks. Should your qualifications meet our requirements, we will be in touch to discuss the next steps in the process.

We appreciate your patience and interest in eHealth4everyone. 

Best regards, 
HR Team
input.subject: Acknowledgment of Your Application for the Consultancy Role at eHealth4everyone

input.prompt: You are an expert resume evaluator tasked with assessing how well a candidate’s past experiences align with the specific role they have applied for. Review the provided job description in detail and compare it against the candidate’s resume. Pay close attention not only to job titles but also to the depth and relevance of responsibilities held. If the candidate briefly held the applied-for role but spent the majority of their career in unrelated or adjacent roles (e.g., applying for a \"People and Business Lead\" role but showing mostly HR roles with minimal strategic or business leadership involvement), they should be awarded a lower score. Prioritize substantial, directly relevant experience over superficial matches. Task: Evaluate Applicant's Relevant Work Experience for the Role of {{trigger['body']['data'][5]['value']}} IMPORTANT: Assessment Criteria: Carefully review the applicant's resume {{step_2}} to determine if they meet the minimum requirement of 7 years of relevant work experience for the role of {{trigger['body']['data'][5]['value']}}. The requirements for this role are; {{step_28}}. Follow these strict validation rules: 1. Invalid Work Experience Criteria: - Missing Job Descriptions: If the work experience section does not include clear job descriptions or listed responsibilities, mark the experience as invalid. - Irrelevant Roles: If the role applied for; {{trigger['body']['data'][5]['value']}} is not explicitly mentioned in the resume or does not closely align with the applicant's work experience, mark the experience as invalid. For example, if an applicant lists 'Admin Assistant' as part of their work experience, this should be considered irrelevant to HR-related roles. - Unspecified Roles: If the work experience only lists company names without specifying the actual roles held during that period, mark the experience as invalid. 2. Experience Calculation Method: - Extract only valid work experiences relevant to the role. - Identify the start and end dates for each role: - If an end date is listed as \"Present,\" assume the end date is {{step_15['result']}}, then calculate the duration as: Years of Experience = Current Year - Start Year - If both start and end years are given, compute the experience as: Years of Experience = End Year - Start Year - Ensure accurate accounting of overlapping periods to prevent double counting. - If the duration of the work experience does not amount to a year, make sure to accumulate the months. - Exclude any irrelevant experience that does not align with the job requirements. 3. Scoring the Experience: - Refer to the scoring metric {{step_3}} and identify the section that evaluates \"Years of Relevant Experience.\" - Assign a strict integer score based on the allocated points in the metric. The score must not exceed the maximum points designated for experience. Final Determination: - Total Years of Relevant Experience: Sum up the valid years of experience after removing invalid and overlapping entries. - Eligibility Check: Confirm whether the applicant meets or exceeds the 7-year minimum requirement for the role. - Final Score: Provide a strict integer score based on the metric {{step_3}} for \"Years of Relevant Experience.\" Additional Recommendation: If the applicant’s qualifications do not align with the applied role, suggest 3 alternative roles within the organization. Use the following list of roles to guide your suggestions: {{step_19}}. The roles you suggest must align with the applicant's skills, experience, and qualifications. Ensure you do not append the position number of the role from the list into your response. Ensure the response is concise and easy to read while accurately assessing the applicant based solely on the specific metric being evaluated. Disregard all other metrics from the scoring criteria that are not relevant to this evaluation.

Task: Evaluate the Applicant’s Industry Relevance and Leadership Experience for the Role of {{trigger['body']['data'][5]['value']}} IMPORTANT: Assessment Criteria: Carefully review the selected relevant work experience from the AI breakdown: {{step_40}} and assess the applicant based on the following two metrics: 1. Industry Relevance: - Analyze the industries in which the applicant has worked and determine whether they align with industries directly related to the job role. - Award higher scores for experience in industries that closely match the role’s requirements {{step_28}}, with greater weight given to longer and more relevant industry experience. - If the applicant has worked primarily in unrelated industries, mark the industry relevance as low. 2. Leadership or Team Experience: - Determine if the applicant held leadership positions or team management roles in any of their past jobs. - Leadership roles include titles such as Team Lead, Manager, Supervisor, Director, or involvement in managing projects or leading teams. - Award higher scores for more extensive leadership experience. Scoring Method: - Refer to the scoring metric {{step_3}} and identify the sections that evaluate \"Industry Relevance\" and \"Leadership or Team Experience.\" - Assign a strict integer score based on the allocated points in the metric. The score must not exceed the maximum points designated for these criteria. Final Determination: - Industry Relevance: Summarize the extent to which the applicant has worked in directly related industries based on the job requirements. - Leadership or Team Experience: Summarize whether the applicant has demonstrated leadership or team management capabilities. - Final Score: Provide a strict integer score based on the metric for \"Industry Relevance\" and \"Leadership or Team Experience.\" Ensure the response is concise and easy to read while accurately assessing the applicant based solely on the specific metric being evaluated. Disregard all other metrics from the scoring criteria that are not relevant to this evaluation.

Task: Evaluate the Applicant’s Specific Skills and Certifications for the Role of {{trigger['body']['data'][5]['value']}} IMPORTANT: Verify if the Applicant's Skills and Certifications are explicitly stated in the resume; if not, assign a score of zero. Exclude the applicant's work experience from this metric, as it does not provide clear and direct information about their skills and certifications. Assessment Criteria: Carefully review the applicant's resume {{step_2}} and assess them based on the following two metrics: 1. Specific Skills or Expertise: - Identify specific skills listed in the resume and compare them to the required skills for the role {{step_28}}. - This includes technical skills, tools, methodologies, and soft skills. - Award higher scores for skills that match the job requirements, with more weight given to essential and highly relevant skills. 2. Certifications and Education: - Review the applicant’s educational background and certifications. - Focus on degrees, diplomas, or certifications relevant to the job role (e.g., a valid degree for a Backend Developer is a B.Sc in Computer Science, technical certifications for IT roles, or industry-specific accreditations). For HR-related roles, applicants must possess a valid HR certification. If this requirement is not met, assign a score of zero. Please refer to the role-specific requirements above, as candidates must have all mandatory certifications; otherwise, they should be scored zero. - Award higher scores for relevant higher education and industry-recognized certifications. Scoring Method: - Refer to the scoring metric {{step_3}} and identify the sections that evaluate \"Specific Skills or Expertise\" and \"Certifications and Education.\" - Assign a strict integer score based on the allocated points in the metric. The score must not exceed the maximum points designated for these criteria. Final Determination: - Specific Skills or Expertise: Summarize how well the applicant's skills align with the job requirements. - Certifications and Education: Summarize whether the applicant has relevant degrees or certifications that enhance their qualifications for the role. - Final Score: Provide a strict integer score based on the metric {{step_3}} for \"Specific Skills or Expertise\" and \"Certifications and Education.\" Ensure the response is concise and easy to read while accurately assessing the applicant based solely on the specific metric being evaluated. Disregard all other metrics from the scoring criteria that are not relevant to this evaluation.

You are an expert resume evaluator tasked with assessing how well a candidate’s past experiences align with the specific role they have applied for. Review the provided job description in detail and compare it against the candidate’s resume. 

Pay close attention not only to job titles but also to the depth and relevance of responsibilities held. If the candidate briefly held the applied-for role but spent the majority of their career in unrelated or adjacent roles (e.g., applying for a "People and Business Lead" role but showing mostly HR roles with minimal strategic or business leadership involvement), they should be awarded a lower score. Prioritize substantial, directly relevant experience over superficial matches.

Task: Evaluate Applicant's Relevant Work Experience for the Role of {{trigger['body']['data'][5]['value']}}
IMPORTANT:
Assessment Criteria:
Carefully review the applicant's resume {{step_2}} to determine if they meet the minimum requirement of 7 years of relevant work experience for the role of {{trigger['body']['data'][5]['value']}}. The requirements for this role are; {{step_28}}. 
Follow these strict validation rules:
1. Invalid Work Experience Criteria:
   - Missing Job Descriptions: If the work experience section does not include clear job descriptions or listed responsibilities, mark the experience as invalid.
   - Irrelevant Roles: If the role applied for; {{trigger['body']['data'][5]['value']}} is not explicitly mentioned in the resume or does not closely align with the applicant's work experience, mark the experience as invalid. For example, if an applicant lists 'Admin Assistant' as part of their work experience, this should be considered irrelevant to HR-related roles. 
   - Unspecified Roles: If the work experience only lists company names without specifying the actual roles held during that period, mark the experience as invalid.
2. Experience Calculation Method:
   - Extract only valid work experiences relevant to the role.
   - Identify the start and end dates for each role:
     - If an end date is listed as "Present," assume the end date is {{step_15['result']}}, then calculate the duration as:
       Years of Experience = Current Year - Start Year
     - If both start and end years are given, compute the experience as:
       Years of Experience = End Year - Start Year
   - Ensure accurate accounting of overlapping periods to prevent double counting.
   - If the duration of the work experience does not amount to a year, make sure to accumulate the months. 
   - Exclude any irrelevant experience that does not align with the job requirements.
3. Scoring the Experience:
   - Refer to the scoring metric {{step_3}} and identify the section that evaluates "Years of Relevant Experience."
   - Assign a strict integer score based on the allocated points in the metric. The score must not exceed the maximum points designated for experience.
Final Determination:
- Total Years of Relevant Experience: Sum up the valid years of experience after removing invalid and overlapping entries.
- Eligibility Check: Confirm whether the applicant meets or exceeds the 7-year minimum requirement for the role.
- Final Score: Provide a strict integer score based on the metric {{step_3}} for "Years of Relevant Experience." 

Additional Recommendation:  
If the applicant’s qualifications do not align with the applied role, suggest 3 alternative roles within the organization. Use the following list of roles to guide your suggestions: {{step_19}}. The roles you suggest must align with the applicant's skills, experience, and qualifications. Ensure you do not append the position number of the role from the list into your response. 
Ensure the response is concise and easy to read while accurately assessing the applicant based solely on the specific metric being evaluated. Disregard all other metrics from the scoring criteria that are not relevant to this evaluation.

Task: Evaluate the Applicant’s Industry Relevance and Leadership Experience for the Role of {{trigger['body']['data'][5]['value']}}
IMPORTANT:
Assessment Criteria:
Carefully review the selected relevant work experience from the AI breakdown: {{step_9}} and assess the applicant based on the following two metrics:
1. Industry Relevance:
   - Analyze the industries in which the applicant has worked and determine whether they align with industries directly related to the job role.
   - Award higher scores for experience in industries that closely match the role’s requirements {{step_28}}, with greater weight given to longer and more relevant industry experience.
   - If the applicant has worked primarily in unrelated industries, mark the industry relevance as low.
2. Leadership or Team Experience:
   - Determine if the applicant held leadership positions or team management roles in any of their past jobs.
   - Leadership roles include titles such as Team Lead, Manager, Supervisor, Director, or involvement in managing projects or leading teams.
   - Award higher scores for more extensive leadership experience.
Scoring Method:
   - Refer to the scoring metric {{step_3}} and identify the sections that evaluate "Industry Relevance" and "Leadership or Team Experience."
   - Assign a strict integer score based on the allocated points in the metric. The score must not exceed the maximum points designated for these criteria.
Final Determination:
- Industry Relevance: Summarize the extent to which the applicant has worked in directly related industries based on the job requirements.
- Leadership or Team Experience: Summarize whether the applicant has demonstrated leadership or team management capabilities.
- Final Score: Provide a strict integer score based on the metric for "Industry Relevance" and "Leadership or Team Experience."
Ensure the response is concise and easy to read while accurately assessing the applicant based solely on the specific metric being evaluated. Disregard all other metrics from the scoring criteria that are not relevant to this evaluation.

Task: Evaluate the Applicant’s Specific Skills and Certifications for the Role of {{trigger['body']['data'][5]['value']}}

IMPORTANT:
Verify if the Applicant's Skills and Certifications are explicitly stated in the resume; if not, assign a score of zero. Exclude the applicant's work experience from this metric, as it does not provide clear and direct information about their skills and certifications.

Assessment Criteria:
Carefully review the applicant's resume {{step_2}} and assess them based on the following two metrics:
1. Specific Skills or Expertise:
   - Identify specific skills listed in the resume and compare them to the required skills for the role {{step_28}}.
   - This includes technical skills, tools, methodologies, and soft skills.
   - Award higher scores for skills that match the job requirements, with more weight given to essential and highly relevant skills.
2. Certifications and Education:
   - Review the applicant’s educational background and certifications.
   - Focus on degrees, diplomas, or certifications relevant to the job role (e.g., a valid degree for a Backend Developer is a B.Sc in Computer Science, technical certifications for IT roles, or industry-specific accreditations). For HR-related roles, applicants must possess a valid HR certification. If this requirement is not met, assign a score of zero. Please refer to the role-specific requirements above, as candidates must have all mandatory certifications; otherwise, they should be scored zero.
   - Award higher scores for relevant higher education and industry-recognized certifications.
Scoring Method:
   - Refer to the scoring metric {{step_3}} and identify the sections that evaluate "Specific Skills or Expertise" and "Certifications and Education."
   - Assign a strict integer score based on the allocated points in the metric. The score must not exceed the maximum points designated for these criteria.
Final Determination:
- Specific Skills or Expertise: Summarize how well the applicant's skills align with the job requirements.
- Certifications and Education: Summarize whether the applicant has relevant degrees or certifications that enhance their qualifications for the role.
- Final Score: Provide a strict integer score based on the metric {{step_3}} for "Specific Skills or Expertise" and "Certifications and Education."
Ensure the response is concise and easy to read while accurately assessing the applicant based solely on the specific metric being evaluated. Disregard all other metrics from the scoring criteria that are not relevant to this evaluation.

From the assessment breakdown; {{step_20}}, extract and sum the scores for the following five metrics: 1. Years of Relevant Experience 2. Industry Relevance 3. Specific Skills or Expertise 4. Certifications and Education 5. Leadership or Team Experience Return only the total score as a single integer. Do not include any comments, formatting, or extra text. The final score must not exceed 100.

Extract the recommended roles of an applicant from the breakdown: {{step_20}}. If there are recommended roles, list them in numbered format. If no roles are recommended, return 'No other roles recommended' without additional text or explanation.

From the assessment breakdown; {{step_20}}, extract and sum the scores for the following five metrics:
1. Years of Relevant Experience
2. Industry Relevance
3. Specific Skills or Expertise
4. Certifications and Education
5. Leadership or Team Experience

Return only the total score as a single integer. Do not include any comments, formatting, or extra text. The final score must not exceed 100.

Extract the recommended roles of an applicant from the breakdown: {{step_20}}. If there are recommended roles, list them in numbered format. If no roles are recommended, return 'No other roles recommended' without additional text or explanation.

input.body:
Dear {{trigger['body']['data'][0]['value']}}, 

Thank you for your interest in the consultancy role at eHealth4everyone. 

After careful consideration, we regret to inform you that your application has not been selected to move forward in the recruitment process. We truly appreciate the time and effort you invested in your application. Although we are unable to proceed with your candidacy at this time, we encourage you to stay connected with us and consider applying for future opportunities that may align with your skills and experience. 

Once again, thank you for considering eHealth4everyone, and we wish you all the best in your future endeavors. 

Best regards, 
HR Team
input.subject: Update on Your Application for the Consultancy Role at eHealth4everyone
